page.title: 01The Mynydd Bach Bontnewydd
page.content: Area bilingual. Native tongue welsh but english becoming predominate. Due to height & nature of area, farming mostly sheep, some dairy. Stone cottages & farms. Very few brick built buildings. Many homes & farms not on mains water or mains sewage systems. Some without bathroom & toilets. Antique furniture restoration, toymaking, macrame & pony trekking are typical cottage industries. Old skills kept going such as wool dyeing & spinning, hedging, ditching, drystone walling. Social life is provided by membership to Women's Institute & young farmers club type institutions. Also by forming groups with common interests such as handicraft groups, welsh learners etc. Bus that runs through sections 5 & 6 is operated by the post office from Aberystwyth. Petrol at shop is still by hand pump.
